data.meta_site_name: Cynthia Kazanowski Obituary | August 28, 2022 | Stone Funeral Home, Inc. - Petoskey, MI
data.text:
Cynthia Lynn Kazanowski, 63, of Petoskey died on August 28, 2022 surrounded by her loving family.

Cindy was born on March 7, 1959 in Dearborn, MI to Vechal and Lena (Corpolongo) Simon. She was raised in Dearborn and attended Oxford Elementary School in Dearborn and graduated from Edsel Ford High School with the Class of 1977.

On December 7, 1985 Cindy married the love of her life, Dr. John Kazanowski and together the two made their home in Bingham Farms, MI where they raised their family. Beginning in the late 1970’s, John and Cynthia began vacationing in the Petoskey, MI area, and made it their full-time home 2 years ago.

Cindy was a mother to all she met. She was everyone’s biggest cheerleader. She was a source of Wisdom, Hope and Love, for her family and friends. She was a believer in all who crossed her path, she never judged, she always inspired.

She enjoyed reading, puzzles, golf, music, dancing, and cooking, however her true passion was her family. Her boys were her life, and she became “Mama Kaz” to all their friends. She was a true Cinderella. Cindy was the definition of elegance and class, she was dependable, full of kindness, caring and above all else was a true friend and confidant.

Cindy is survived by her husband, Dr John Kazanowski; 3 sons, Justin (Emily) Kazanowski, Adam Kazanowski, and Michael Kazanowski; siblings, Linda (Fred) Systma, Deborah VanBuren, and Larry (Jennie) Simon; brothers-in law, Roger Kazanowski and Robert (Diane) Kazanowski; sister-in-law, Cara Kazanowski; and by many nieces and nephews.

She was preceded in death by her brothers-in-law, Lawrence Kazanowski and Nicholas Richardson.

The family will receive friends at the Stone Funeral Home at 2098 East Mitchell Road, Petoskey, MI 49770 on Thursday, September 1st from 4-9pm. Visitation will continue on Friday from 10-11am the Genesis Church of Petoskey at 1124 Northmen Dr, Petoskey, MI 49770. Funeral services celebrating Cynthia’s life will immediately follow the visitation at 11am.

At request of the family, gifts in memory of Cynthia Kazanowski can be made out to Genesis Church to be distributed for humanitarian activities around the world.
